definition: to flatter/to fawn on/to butter sb up/toadying/bootlicking
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
fart/flatulence/nonsense/(usu. in the negative) what/(not) a damn thing

sentences.english: When I please my boss, I am ass-kissing.
sentences.chinese: 當我討上司歡心的時候，我是拍馬屁。

sentences.english: Ross: All right, so I don't know what sycophant means, but the rest is right.
sentences.chinese: 那我不知道“拍馬屁”的意思，但餘下的是對的。
他只是一個樂於拍馬屁的人。

sentences.english: In many cases, it is possible that there are other employees who merit these advantages more than the brown-noser.
sentences.chinese: 可是，在情況下，的員工比拍馬屁者更有好處。

sentences.english: To seek favor or attention by flattery and obsequious behavior .
sentences.chinese: 用拍馬屁和諂媚的態度來取悅，引起注意。

sentences.english: He openly crawled to the boss.
sentences.chinese: 他公開地對老闆拍馬屁。

sentences.english: A flatterer's throat is an open sepulcher.
sentences.chinese: 拍馬屁者的喉嚨就是打開的墳墓。

sentences.english: Apple polishers are a pain in the neck to conscientious teachers.
sentences.chinese: 對於有良心的教師，拍馬屁的學生實在討厭極了。

sentences.english: Where there is a flatterer, there is also a fool.
sentences.chinese: 哪裏有拍馬屁的，那裏就有傻瓜。

sentences.english: Without kowtowing, you should concentrate on doing your own job well.
sentences.chinese: 不用拍馬屁，你應該專心把自己的工作做好。

sentences.english: They patronize; they treat children as inferiors.
sentences.chinese: 他們學會了拍馬屁，覺得孩子不如他們。

sentences.english: He got the promotion just because he was a bootlicker to the higher-ups.
sentences.chinese: 他就是因爲拍馬屁纔得到了提升。
我痛恨他拍馬屁的恭維。

sentences.english: You are not going to get that promotion just by brown-nosing.
sentences.chinese: 你單靠拍馬屁是得不到提升的。

sentences.english: The man with whom you talked is a apple polisher .
sentences.chinese: 和你談話的那人是一個拍馬屁的人。

definition: to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
red in the face/extremely angry
to force someone to do something
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to exaggerate
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
druggist
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
complete nonsense (idiom)
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
